metadata.title: CVE-2017-7109 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in certain Apple products. iOS before 11 is affected. Safari before 11 is affected. iCloud before 7.0 on Windows is affected. iTunes before 12.7 on Windows is affected. tvOS before 11 is affected. The issue involves the "WebKit" component. A cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via crafted web content that incorrectly interacts with the Application Cache policy.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-7109` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.18.0-2
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.18.0-2
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.18.0-2
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.18.0-2
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.18.0-2
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.18.0-2
No subscription required

notes.note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.18.0-2').
